pros: Started there as a new RN, learned so much about patient care from this place. I would consider returning if pay is increased.
cons: Nurse to patient ratios were high, but then again I’m sure everyone is experiencing this.

pros: Long break , good team, development
cons: None right now to list

pros: Friendly staff, great patients, & laid back management. Management will listen to your concerns & the location is good
cons: Management is too lax. Pay is not good & raises are inconsistent as well as rare. HR is unprofessional & rude. The board & physicians should have more say (the CEO is not clinical/hospital minded & it shows). The new marketing/CEO assistant is inexperienced & doesn’t have ideas or vision. The harder you work, the more responsibility you will get… makes staff burnout resulting in turnovers.

review_title: Excellent Teamwork, Great Pay w/contract bonuses
pros: Nurses work as a strong team on certain units. Lots of charge nurse support, Unit director is on your side & gets stuff done. Teaching hospital with a just culture. Their goal is for you to learn, keep getting better and to stay and teach your knowledge to new nurses.
cons: Not all floors are the same.

pros: You will use all your skill set you will work with great surgeons and anethesist in OR

He has done this to hospitals in Atlanta area before and now at grady. He also have friends he has hired and plays favoritism towards those workers and hard ship to the rest.

pros: Best place to learn and get your experience, as it is the biggest teaching hospital in atlanta

review_title: Great Life Altering Experience for the Good of many medical careers.
pros: Because this hospital refuses NO ONE at ANY time for ANY reason, studying in the health field of your choice allows you to gain an abundance of knowledge and hands-on experience. The staff is a confidant and the patients are SPECIAL.
cons:
Our AMA and health regulations forbid holding patients hostage even if it's for their own well being. Patients have access to leave the hospital in hospital attire and return as they please. To discourage this behavior some hospitals  have
 designed the entrance and walkways with LONG path walks and grassy flower beds NO hallway benches except in the downstairs foyer. Remove the outside benches which invite a place for diseased, contagious patients to fellowship
with passer Byers and the public in general.

pros: Great, efficient, supportive, caring and educative
cons: Busy, may get burned out

review_title: Enjoyed the experience working at Grady Memorial Hospital
job_title: Cardiac Monitor Technician in Atlanta, GA
pros: Working with critical care patients.
cons: Poor management and hard to move up within Grady.

pros: Working here you develop a thick skin
cons: Poor management, sexually harassed and physically assaulted by employees and superiors, poor salary

review_title: Proud and Honored to be part of something that serves It's community and the whole city.
pros: The Staff is the best any where, evryone has a willingness to help at the drop of a dime. the hard work never goes unoticed and the changes in medicine have allowed Grady to stay at the top with education and training. Where ever you work you will experience it all, you will be well versed. Being close to the train station helps those who can't get there any other way.
cons: The pay is not competative with the market in some of the Allied health positions.

pros: The new CEO has really came in and did a lot of improvement in our health system.  We have received new equipment. We have 2 to 3 mandatory employee meetings to keep us informed of the new changes that are taking place.
cons: No teamwork. There is not enough good communication between the imaging departments and nurses. If the patient is to have multiple imaging test there should be communication between all imaging departments so the patient does not have to be transported multiple times to the different imaging department.

review_title: Overall Not A Very Good Environment
pros: Stable employment. Many friendly people
cons: An atmosphere of nepotism and playing favorites- many times hiring friends and family, which eliminates any diversity in the organization. Many of these types of hires are way under qualified for their positions and its reflected by their performance. Also a misogynistic leader. Very few raises are given, and when there are raises the amount is very small. Large turnover and low salaries for "lower level" employees. Some employees do the work of several without a increase in pay. If your not a doctor or upper management, find another place to work if you can.

review_title: I have done charge and also worked ER and ICU all of them I think.  Love working at Grady
job_title: RN ICU ER in Atlanta, GA
pros: It is a great place as  New RN I was thrilled to see soo many things there I only read about. It is my favorite place to work. I was agency first several years..Back in the 80's. and then I was on staff for Neuro Stroke ICU. I was recruited there and loved it.
cons: I see not any cons in Grady other than now many other RNs have come to see how great it is to work and learn always new things..So no cons...sorry

pros: You have a job. You are helping others
cons: Unorganized department, poor management, training manager does not know software. We have the train the managers. No opportunities for growth. Not inside of Grady , it is on MLK where it has poor work environment,  no rewards or recognition. Department never consistent.... Poor patient care if you have a heart...this is a hard place to work with a conscience.
